title: What is the relation between angular acceleration and tangential acceleration? - Quora

response.answer_text: Well my friend it’s obviously the Radius. Angular AND Tangential acceleration both have units of Angular Speed and Tangential Speed over time. The usual relationship between Tangential and Angular speed is the Radius. Naturally there is no “time proportionality” between “tangential time” and “angular time” rather than a plain simple “1”. Ergo “Tangential Acceleration = R * Angular Acceleration” Hope ive been clear.

tangential acceleration = (radius of the rotation)(angular acceleration) a-tan = rα a-tan = tangential acceleration r = radius of the object's rotation α = angular acceleration, with units radians/s^2
